metadata.title: CVE-2021-3148 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in SaltStack Salt before 3002.5. Sending craftedweb requests to the Salt API can result in salt.utils.thin.gen_thin()command injection because of different handling of single versus doublequotes. This is related to salt/utils/thin.py.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3148` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

salt-api - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2+esm1
salt-cloud - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2+esm1
salt-common - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2+esm1
salt-master - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2+esm1
salt-minion - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2+esm1
salt-proxy - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2+esm1
salt-ssh - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2+esm1
salt-syndic - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: salt package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2017.7.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu18.04.2+esm1').
